quest.name: Chaos, Carnage, Eggs
journal:
Hamlyn is quivering in his excitement.
※This quest is available for a limited time only.

It turns out that Hamlyn's master plan to restore peace to the plundered caravan is strikingly similar─if not utterly identical─to the plan you carried out not moments ago. If it will solve your sylph dilemma long enough to get your hands on some glorious eggs, however, you're willing to give it the old Archon try. You head to the Central Shroud and prepare to combat the sylphs' jealous mood with some green of your own.

※Please note that you will be unable to complete this quest after the seasonal event has ended. For details, please check the Lodestone.
※The FATE “Don't Be Sylphish” can only be completed as a Disciple of War or Magic.

After a frantic scuffle involving sylphs, a giant mammet, and more shuffling than is comfortable for the average tonberry, you manage to recover the scattered Archon eggs. Panting from exertion and pleased to be free of your sweaty guise (once more pawed off you by an overzealous Hamlyn), you trek back to Gridania to give Jihli the good news.

Hamlyn is singing your praises─or, more accurately, the noble tonberry's praises─with phlegmy excitement when you arrive, lamenting only the absence of large crowds who might have witnessed the miraculous feats performed by his adorable idols. As it turns out, enough townsfolk were present to warrant extending personal thanks for returning their precious eggs─which they ought to decorate as tonberries to prevent any further sylph shenanigans, Hamlyn helpfully suggests. While Hamlyn could not be less subtle in his tonberry touting, you can't deny the modicum of truth in his suggestion, and really, you'd just like to get on with it already. Jihli smiles and officially proclaims the start of Hatching–tide─let the eggy, eggy, stabby fun begin!
objectives: Complete the FATE “Don't Be Sylphish” in the Central Shroud.

dialogue.name: JIHLIALIAPOH
dialogue.text: I beg you, Forename─speak with Hamlyn and see how we might recover those Archon eggs!

dialogue.name: NONOTTA
dialogue.text: All those eggs... All those beautifully decorated─and expensive─eggs...

dialogue.name: HAMLYN
dialogue.text: You wish to lend your strength to my brilliant plan, do you? <snort> Very well. Our divine mission is as follows─we must adorn ourselves in the guise of the tonberry, and scare the sylphs away from the fallen eggs!

dialogue.name: HAMLYN
dialogue.text: ...Ahem, it may seem like a rather familiar tactic, but terror cuts as sharply as a knife in the right hands. As does the power of the tonberry! <snort> We shall remind those sylphs of what adorable horror lurks in the shadow.

dialogue.name: HAMLYN
dialogue.text: It is time to take the tonberry's naturally winsome and captivating visage and transform it into a mask of pure evil.

dialogue.name: HAMLYN
dialogue.text: Observe!

dialogue.name: NONOTTA
dialogue.text: I...suppose that makes sense. But what of the delivery mammet? In its panicked state, it may easily mistake us for naught but common egg-thieves─er, perhaps not so common, considering the guises.

dialogue.name: HAMLYN
dialogue.text: That's where Forename's participation is crucial. <snort> Even an overexcited automaton is no match for an adventurer versed in the arts of warfare!

dialogue.name: HAMLYN
dialogue.text: Of course, I shan't be so cruel as to send you into battle as defenseless as a swaddled tonbabe.

dialogue.name: HAMLYN
dialogue.text: You may rely upon me to perform the necessary <shlorp> enhancements upon your guise, that shall grant any stabby sweetheart the ability to withstand even the harshest of electrified zaps! ...In theory, anyway.

dialogue.name: HAMLYN
dialogue.text: In the midst of adversity lies opportunity, as they say─or rather, in the midst of scattered Archon eggs stands the noble tonberry, that all might witness its triumphant glory!

dialogue.name: JIHLIALIAPOH
dialogue.text: Very well. Let us proceed with Hamlyn's plan and see that our eggs are recovered safely.

dialogue.name: HAMLYN
dialogue.text: Hmhm, excellent! <snort> I shall commence the enhancement of this guise at once and have it ready for deployment in two flicks of a tonberry's blade. Forename─let us meet where the bells of destiny toll. To arms!

dialogue.name: JIHLIALIAPOH
dialogue.text: I shall contact the Adventurers' Guild to see if any there are willing to help as well.

dialogue.name: NONOTTA
dialogue.text: You'll find the caravan by the Mirror Planks in the Central Shroud. You can't miss it─not even if you tried.

dialogue.name: NONOTTA
dialogue.text: You did it, Forename! You truly did it!

dialogue.name: HAMLYN
dialogue.text: 'Twas sheer majesty, the likes of which I have never seen! <heavy breathing>

dialogue.name: JIHLIALIAPOH
dialogue.text: And here comes our hero now! Hamlyn has just been regaling us with the tale of your valor, Forename.

dialogue.name: NONOTTA
dialogue.text: We can't thank you enough for recovering those Archon eggs. Truly─from the bottom of our hearts and purses─thank you!

dialogue.name: HAMLYN
dialogue.text: My single regret is that no rapturous bystanders were present in those solitary woods to witness such valorous displays.

dialogue.name: HAMLYN
dialogue.text: Alas, the tonberry's majesty will once again pass unacknowledged. Yet, such is often the way with true goodness. <snort> The hero that works in secrecy for the betterment of all? My friends, their name is tonberry.

dialogue.name: NONOTTA
dialogue.text: (-Nonotta-)Profound, I'm sure. I must say, Hamlyn, your unflagging devotion to all things tonberry is both remarkable and admirable...

dialogue.name: RESIDENTSB04722
dialogue.text: (-???-)Erm, pardon me!

dialogue.name: RESIDENTSB04722
dialogue.text: We were in those solitary woods! And we saw what you did for us. ...Er, what the tonberries did for us.

dialogue.name: RESIDENTSB04722
dialogue.text: I was heartbroken when a sylph snatched away the Archon egg that my friend had given me...

dialogue.name: RESIDENTSB04722
dialogue.text: ...But thanks to you, it was recovered safely. You tonberries have my eternal thanks.

dialogue.name: RESIDENTSB04722
dialogue.text: I only wish you didn't have to scare the sylphs so badly. The poor things... Is there no other way to deter their mischief?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Sylph-repellant, perhaps?

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: My tonberry senses are tingling...

dialogue.name: HAMLYN
dialogue.text: Indeed! <snort> Consider this─if we decorate our eggs with a tonberry theme, the sylphs wouldn't dare snatch or sabotage them!

dialogue.name: NONOTTA
dialogue.text: A dark green coat on a large egg with two golden circles for eyes? Not bad at all. Perhaps even...cute!

dialogue.name: NONOTTA
dialogue.text: Jihli, perhaps this is what your dream foretold. Not just tonberry guises, but tonberry eggs and decorations as well!

dialogue.name: NONOTTA
dialogue.text: In which case, we should send word to our Ul'dahn goldsmiths that we'd like another batch of Archon eggs in some striking shades of tonberry.

dialogue.name: JIHLIALIAPOH
dialogue.text: Of course, all our eggs are packaged during transit, meaning the sylphs will likely continue their mischief outside the city. I'm tempted to send a tonberry guard with the caravan, but the road from Ul'dah is far too long to attempt in such a guise.

dialogue.name: JIHLIALIAPOH
dialogue.text: We shall continue to consider possible alternatives, but in the meantime, should you happen to come across another waylaid shipment, I hope I can count on your assistance. Er...as a tonberry, of course.

dialogue.name: JIHLIALIAPOH
dialogue.text: Well, seeing as our Archon eggs have finally arrived, I daresay it is time to officially get cracking! Let the Hatching–tide festivities begin!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You have unlocked the Egg Hunter Riggy mini-game. To play mini-games, open the toy chest found in any inn room.
